definition: Paris Commune 1871, an unsuccessful proletarian uprising against the French Third Republic
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Li ethnic group of Hainan Province/surname Li/abbr. for Lebanon 黎巴嫩[Li2 ba1 nen4]

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: The year 1871 witnessed the heroic uprising of the Paris Commune.
sentences.chinese: 1871年爆发了英勇的巴黎公社起义。

sentences.english: "The Paris Commune, " said Lenin, "was the first step.
sentences.chinese: “巴黎公社，”列宁说，“迈出了第一步。”

sentences.english: The principles of the Paris Commune are eternal.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎公社的原则是永存的。

sentences.english: She wrote a book on the Paris Commune .
sentences.chinese: 巴黎公社的原则是永存的。

sentences.english: The Paris Commune is the social rudiments to practice Marx's theory of "rebuilding the individual ownership".
sentences.chinese: 巴黎公社是马克思的“重建个人所有制”的社会雏形。

sentences.english: The Commune was being drowned in its own blood.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎公社被淹没在自己的血泊之中。

sentences.english: A part of "The Wall of the Communards" still stands;
sentences.chinese: 直到今天，巴黎公社社员墙的一部分依然屹立。

sentences.english: The principles of paris commune are eternal .
sentences.chinese: 巴黎公社的原则是永存的。

sentences.english: The principles of the Paris Commune radiates with eternal light.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎公社的原则闪耀着不灭的光辉。

definition: Jacobin club, French revolutionary party that played a leading role in the reign of terror 1791-1794
bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
pinyin: zi1 chan3 jie1 ji2 ge2 ming4

definition: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Eugène Edine Pottier (1816-1887), French revolutionary socialist and poet

pinyin: Xin1 Min2 zhu3 zhu3 yi4 Ge2 ming4

definition: Robespierre (name)/Maximilien François Marie Isidore de Robespierre (1758-1794), French revolutionary leader, enthusiastic advocate of reign of terror 1791-1794
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
